metadata.title: CVE-2023-52768 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:wilc1000: use vmm_table as array in wilc struct Enabling KASAN and runningsome iperf tests raises some memory issues with vmm_table: BUG: KASAN:slab-out-of-bounds in wilc_wlan_handle_txq+0x6ac/0xdb4 Write of size 4 ataddr c3a61540 by task wlan0-tx/95 KASAN detects that we are writing databeyond range allocated to vmm_table. There is indeed a mismatch between thesize passed to allocator in wilc_wlan_init, and the range of possibleindexes used later: allocation size is missing a multiplication bysizeof(u32)

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
